quotes.quote: Everyone has a colorful life. You just have to get out your crayons.
Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
Art is your personal diary where you may color your thoughts and emotions on a page.
Give crayons. Adults are disturbingly impoverished of these magical dream sticks.
Beauty without colour seems somehow to belong to another world.
Artists are just children who refuse to put down their crayons.
We could learn a lot from crayons; some are sharp, some are pretty, some are dull, while others bright, some have weird names, but they all have learned to live together in the same box.
Never invest in any idea you can't illustrate with a crayon.
Pink is not just a color, it's an attitude
Colour could give rise to sensations which would interfere with our conception of space.
History written in pencil is easily erased, but crayon is forever.
Color affects us. Everyone should have a paintbox and a large box of crayons.
Colour is, on the evidence of language alone, very bound up with the feelings.
Broken crayons still colour the same
Red is passion-lit, orange is flowerageous, yellow is suntastic, pink is lipsensual, green is lifebursting, blue is skyful, purple is berrydancing, gray is cloudrainy.
Coloring outside the lines is a fine art.
Stop counting crayons, just draw pictures.
An artist spends himself like the crayon in his hand, till he is all gone.
Colour is a creative element, not a trimming.
If you were a crayon, what color would you most like to make out with?
All the other colors are just colors, but purple seems to have a soul â€” when you look at it, it's looking back at you.
Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.

Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.

A box of new crayons! Now they're all pointy, lined up in order, bright and perfect. Soon they'll be a bunch of ground down, rounded, indistinguishable stumps, missing their wrappers and smudged with other colors. Sometimes life seems unbearably tragic.
Our attitudes are the crayons that color our world.
No things could seem further apart than the doubt of grey and the decision of scarlet. Yet grey and red can mingle, as they do in the morning clouds.
Color... thinks by itself, independently of the object it clothes.
A box of crayons and a big sheet of paper provides a more expressive medium for kids than computerized paint programs.
